Barry.Action: Despite others being shot and chaos around, blood tracks lead away from the crash site, implying Barry escaped or moved deliberately, showing situational awareness and quick thinking.
Pazar criticizes Barry for ignoring warnings and going after him anyway, showing possible recklessness or failure to heed advice.
Is indirectly implicated in a misunderstanding leading to aggression but does not escalate conflict; situation resolved through communication.
Urgently urges Chris to leave quickly after Ponch is shot, showing concern for their safety.
Tells Chris to pick up the gun instead of letting it drop, indicating practical care and responsibility for their situation.
Does not engage in hostility towards Ponch, instead tries to manage the dangerous situation calmly.
Cowers behind a junked car after SUV flipped, appearing physically worse for wear.
Quickly gets up after Chris shoots Ponch, showing presence of mind and urgency.
Commands Chris to pick up the gun and get rid of it, indicating situational awareness and decisiveness.
Distracted by a text from Sally about rehearsal starting while on the run, showing divided focus.
Enters looking disheveled, caught off guard by news and quick changes in the scene.
Shows confusion and surprise at changes in the script and chaotic environment, indicating lack of preparation.
Rolls eyes and curtly tells Chris to stop calling and to 'chill the fuck out' during a phone conversation
Delays entering stage by staying on an agitated phone call, ignoring the timing of performance
Slumps into a seat after a failed performance, accepts criticism silently.
Denies using drugs when confronted by Cousineau.
Tells Chris to relax and keep quiet about the killing, reassuring him that staying silent will keep them safe.
Warns Chris that calling the police will put him and his family in danger from dangerous people.
Encourages loyalty by emphasizing their link and discourages Chris from turning himself in.
Calmly advises Chris to stay quiet and lay low after a dangerous event, demonstrating awareness of the stakes and how to manage the situation.
Confidently explains the risks of involving the police and implies knowledge of the people who hired him, showing understanding of the bigger picture.
Repeatedly tells Chris to relax despite Chris’s distress, indicating some emotional control but possibly dismissing Chris’s concerns without fully addressing them.
Threatens the consequences for Chris’s family if Chris involves the police, revealing a ruthless mindset but also an understanding of leverage and power dynamics.
Does not offer any concrete plan or solution beyond 'lay low and stay quiet,' which might indicate a lack of proactive problem-solving or contingency planning.
Warns Chris that turning himself in will lead to dangerous consequences for everyone linked to them, showing concern for others' safety.
Keeps silent when Chris expresses his intent to come clean, not encouraging or supporting him openly.
Stares at Chris after questioning his statements, implying a moment of sincere, intense communication.
Repeatedly questions Chris about his intentions, prompting reflection rather than support.
Does not verbally reassure Chris when he tries to keep things quiet and admits he lied to his wife, remaining silent.
Shoots Chris after a confrontation, despite Chris expressing trust in him.
Screams in distress immediately after shooting Chris.
Sweeps his tracks after leaving the scene to avoid detection.
Shoots Chris decisively when threatened, then quickly covers his tracks by sweeping away evidence as he leaves the scene.
Screams loudly after shooting Chris, expressing panic or loss of control immediately after taking decisive action.
Appears dazed and looks like hell sitting in the Uber, suggesting vulnerability.
Graciously accepts applause and modestly shrugs it off during the imagined performance.
Beholds Sally from the wings, amazed and in love, indicating sincere affection and admiration.
Looks dazed and disheveled in the Uber just before the performance, seeming unprepared or overwhelmed.
Enters the stage gracefully, accepting applause modestly and delivering his lines with a notable British accent reminiscent of a great actor.
Holds a gun to Chris's head, causing Chris to fire.
Struggles to concentrate and keep himself together during a high-pressure moment, repeatedly trying to shake off distracting, painful daydreams.
Shows clear signs of being overwhelmed and unable to perform effectively in a critical situation involving a talent agent.
Breaks down crying on stage, showing real tears of wrenching grief, frustration, desperation, and bravery in expressing deep self-loathing, regret, guilt, and shame.
Despite overwhelming emotional pain and grief, Barry summons monumental effort to speak his line bravely and with real emotion on stage.
After delivering his line, he weeps uncontrollably and stumbles off stage, showing difficulty in maintaining composure and control.
Paces like a caged animal, still manic, crying after the performance.
Punches the framed photo of Cousineau and Judd Hirsch in frustration.
Avoids the crowd, tries to leave backstage unnoticed after performance.
Paces like a caged animal, manic and crying, tears off jacket, punches framed photo in frustration.
Although emotionally overwhelmed, reaches a deep, previously unseen emotional place in his performance that impresses Cousineau and the crowd.
Leaves immediately after performance in a daze, trying not to be seen, avoiding social interaction and feedback.
Helps Sally get the business card from Daniel without her having to act, enabling her opportunity.
Responds to Sally's gratitude quietly and modestly with 'Oh. Cool.' and 'I am?'
Does not engage further after Sally runs off, stands alone quietly on stage.
Successfully supports Sally by effectively enabling her to secure a valuable industry contact; Sally praises Barry's acting and generosity, indicating a skilled and confident performance on his part.
Responds to Sally's praise with uncertainty ('I am?'), showing some self-doubt or lack of confidence in his own abilities despite external recognition.
